string-array.name: explain_open_wifi
string-array.item: Bottom line: Don\'t do anything on this network that you wouldn\'t want someone else seeing.

Explanation: Open networks such as this have no security features enabled. This typically means that ALL DATA is readable by anyone nearby.The exception is if you are visiting a web site or service that uses encryption. Web sites that use encryption will always have a URL which begins with \"https\" rather than \"http\". Services will vary by provider - if you are not certain that they use encryption, it is usually best to play it safe and wait until you are on a more secure network.

string-array.name: explain_wep
string-array.item: Bottom line: Proceed with caution! This network has minor protection that is easily broken.

string-array.name: explain_wps
string-array.item: Bottom line: You are probably safe, but be forewarned. This network can be rather easily hacked.

Explanation: WPS is a system which allows you to more easily connect devices to a wireless network. Properly implemented, this poses little threat. However, recent developments have allowed attackers to use this system to gain unauthorized access with relative ease. Though the attack is not yet commonplace - it\'s popularity is sure to grow.

string-array.name: explain_wpa
string-array.item: Bottom line: This network uses an excellent form of security. It\'s only real weakness is an easy password - make sure it\'s a good one.

Explanation: WPA and WPA2 are considered the best form of wireless security. They are typically used with a shared password (one password per network). This means that the security is only as good as the password. Make sure it\'s hard to guess and that only the people who are allowed on the network know it.

string-array.name: explain_tkip
string-array.item: Bottom line: You are most likely perfectly safe. However, this network uses an older form of encryption which has several known vulnerabilities.

Explanation: TKIP is an older form of security which has similar attributes to the equally old WEP system. In fact, those attributes are so similar that it is vulnerable to the same types of attacks. In general, using TKIP should be avoided in favor of the newer AES or CCMP systems.

string-array.name: explain_aes
string-array.item: Bottom line: Excellent encryption! AES is quite literally the gold-standard for securing communications.

Explanation: AES is one of the strongest forms of security available. It is used in everything from encrypting wireless networks to protecting military and government secrets. There are no known direct attacks against AES. However, dumb luck and poor implementation can still provide back-doors for attackers. As with most things, you should trust but verify.
